t: A psalm of David. When he was in the Desert of Judah.
You,*pn God, are my God, earnestly*ld I seek you; I*ln thirst for you, my*ld whole being longs for you, in*ln a dry and parched land where*ld there is no water.
I*pn have seen you in the sanctuary and*ld beheld your power and your glory.
Because*ln your love is better than life, my*ld lips will glorify you.
I*ln will praise you as long as I live, and*ld in your name I will lift up my hands.
I*ln will be fully satisfied as with the richest of foods; with*ld singing lips my mouth will praise you.
On*pn my bed I remember you; I*ld think of you through the watches of the night.
Because*ln you are my help, I*ld sing in the shadow of your wings.
I*ln cling to you; your*ld right hand upholds me.
Those*pn who want to kill me will be destroyed; they*ld will go down to the depths of the earth.
They*ln will be given over to the sword and*ld become food for jackals.
But*pn the king will rejoice in God; all*ld who swear by God will glory in him, while*ld the mouths of liars will be silenced.
